item.title: PRIA Process Improvement Workgroup
item.description:
For more information contact Pete Caulkins (caulkins.peter@epa.gov).

On this page:
  • Objective
  • Background
  • Meetings

Objective

The workgroup provides advice to the Agency on improvements to increase the efficiency of the registration and registration review processes and to meet statutory due dates under the Pesticide Registration Improvement Renewal Act.

Background

The Pesticide Registration Improvement Act created Section 33 of FIFRA and established a pesticide registration fee system, among other requirements. Section 33(e) of FIFRA directs EPA to identify and evaluate reforms to the pesticide registration process with the goal of reducing decision review times for pesticide registration applications. Section 33(k) directs the Agency to report its recommendations for process improvements in the handling of and streamlining registration review.

The PRIA Process Improvement Workgroup was created in FY 2004 at the suggestion and under the auspices of the Agency’s Federal Advisory Committee, the Pesticide Program Dialogue Committee, to evaluate process improvements in EPA’s pesticides program. The workgroup is composed of members from pesticide registrant companies, pesticide trade associations, public interest groups, and Agency staff. Meetings are open to the public.

List of members of the PRIA Process Improvement Workgroup

During meetings, industry stakeholders and Agency staff identify areas for improvement in the registration and registration review process, including:

  • labeling consistency;
  • communication of schedules;
  • use of electronic tools;
  • application and submission guidance; and
  • efficiencies in product reregistration and registration review.

Stakeholders present their priorities for process improvement and the Agency:

  • discusses the status of its improvement projects;
  • previews new tools and proposed changes in procedures and processes;
  • presents analyses of specific processes; and
  • reports on its successes.

Future projects and efforts are identified through a dialogue between the Agency and stakeholders.

Meetings

This workgroup met several times in 2010 and 2011. Information from those meetings can be found in the archive.

item.title: Pesticide Program Dialogue Committee: Pollinator Protection Plan Metrics Workgroup
item.description:
On this page:
  • Next meeting
  • Previous meetings
  • Objective
  • Workgroup members

Next Meetings

  • January 18, 2017 2:00 pm – 3:30 pm EST; call-in

Previous Meetings

  • December 1, 2016 
  • November 1, 2016
  • October 12, 2016

Objective

The workgroup is charged with developing: 1) recommendations for how to evaluate/measure the effectiveness of state- and tribal-recognized pollinator protection plans at the national level; and, 2) a strategy to communicate that effectiveness to the public (defined broadly).  The workgroup’s goal is to make final recommendations to the full PPDC by fall of 2017.

Workgroup members

  • Ray Brinkmeyer, DOW AgroSciences
  • Mary Clock-Rust, EPA Office of Pesticide Programs
  • Dee Colby, EPA Office of Pesticide Programs
  • Michel Colopy, Pollinator Stewardship Council, Inc.
  • Steven Coy, Coy Bee Company
  • Richard Crespin, CollaborateUP
  • Mark Dykes, Apiary Inspectors of America
  • David Epstein, USDA
  • Jim Fredericks, NPMA
  • Nichelle Harriott, Beyond Pesticides
  • Tim Hatten, University of Idaho and Invertebrate Ecology Inc.
  • Aaron Hobbs, Responsible Industry for a Sound Environment (RISE)
  • Dudley Hoskins, NASDA
  • Rose Kachadoorian, Oregon Department of Agriculture
  • Jeanette Klopchin, Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
  • Meredith Laws, EPA Office of Pesticide Programs
  • Jim Lyons, USGS Patuxent Wildlife Research Center
  • Jayme Mestes, Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe
  • Tom Moriarty, EPA Office of Pesticide Programs
  • Don Parker, National Cotton Council
  • Peg Perreault, EPA Region 8
  • Caydee Savinelli, Syngenta
  • Julie Shapiro, Keystone Policy Center
  • Robin Shepard, North Central Cooperative Extension Association
  • Tom Steeger, EPA Office of Pesticide Programs
  • Tim Tucker, beekeepers associated with the American Beekeeping Federation
  • Al Summers, CO Professional Beekeepers Association
  • Tom Van Arsdall, Pollinator Partnership
  • Andy Whittington, Mississippi Farm Bureau

EPA Workgroup Leadership

  • Mike Goodis, Acting Director, Registration Division, Office of Pesticide Programs - Lead
  • Marietta Echeverria, Chief, Invertebrate & Vertebrate Branch 1, Registration Division, Office of Pesticide Programs - Co-Lead

For more information, contact Dee Colby (colby.deanna@epa.gov).

Top of Page

item.title: Pesticide Program Dialogue Committee Meeting November 2 - 3, 2016
item.description:
For more information, contact Dea Zimmerman, zimmerman.dea@epa.gov, 312-353-6344.

See the FR Notice for this meeting.

  • Meeting Agenda (PDF)(3 pp, 209 K, November 2 - 3, 2016)
  • Session 1 OPP's Role in Agricultural Biotechnology Today and Tomorrow (PDF)(34 pp, 462 K)
  • Session 2 Zika Update (PDF)(2 pp, 334 K)
  • Session 3 Pollinator Protection Updates: Acute Bee Mitigation Proposal and Neonicotinoid Risk Assessment Schedule (PDF)(6 pp, 288 K)
  • Session 5 Updates on the Certification of Pesticide Applicators Rule and Implementation Activities of the Revised Worker Protection Standard (PDF)(17 pp, 199 K)
  • Session 7a Acute 6-Pack Testing Alternatives (PDF)(2 pp, 501 K)
  • Session 7b ESA Implementation Update (PDF)(1 pg, 155 K)
  • Session 7c Draft Framework for Incorporating Human Epidemiologic & Incident Data in Health Risk Assessment (PDF)(2 pp, 205 K)
  • Session 7d PRIA 4 Update (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K)
  • Session 7e Resistance Management Update (PDF)(2 pp, 201 K)
  • Ssession 7f Chlorpyrifos Update (PDF)(1 pg, 126 K)
  • Session 7g Glyphosate Update (PDF)(1 pg, 204 K)
